examples: […]  if a Parliament be triable and arraignable before the King himselfe: Then hath the King an unlimited declarative power of Law above all Courts, in his own breast;

entries.meaning: (law) For which a person is liable to be arraigned.
examples: Their words may not have been arraignable by law, (though in many cases they were so) but they were such as their hearers could give but one interpretation to.
